repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.langmaterial: Materials are in English, French, Mandarin, Spanish, and Portuguese.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in 12 series: Origins and founding documents; Board of Directors records; CEO records; Financial records; Communications and External Affairs records; Resource Development records; Human Resources records; Center for Financial Inclusion records; Global Programs records; Administrative records; Strategic planning records; and Conference records.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The bulk of this collection was originally organized by Erin Dornbusch at ACCION in 2012. Initial accessions in Series 001 and 006 were processed at the folder level by Sarah Gustafson in 2013. The remainder of the collection was minimally processed in November 2015 -- March 2016 by Dan Bullman and Rose Oliveira, Archives and Research Assistants, under the supervision of Adrienne Pruitt, Collections Management Archivist.

In MS196.006.006: Communications and External Affairs records - Photographs and audiovisual materials, Some items will require further preservation actions in the future, such as rehousing uncut negatives and loose slides. An attempt may be made to reformat two decaying film reels (MS196.006.006.086), if they are salvageable. Duplicate slides and a mousepad were separated for return to the donor. Two used instant film cameras and one roll of exposed 35mm film were also separated pending further donor decisions.

In MS196.008: Human Resources records, Photograph albums were rehoused in a new box. These could be potentially be disassembled for preservation reasons, if a more granular level of processing is done in the future.

In MS196.009, 1.5 cubic feet of duplicative material was separated from the collection. A half of a box of materials related to the merger between ACCION USA and Peer Partnerships INC., Working Capital was moved from Series 9 to Series 10. This material was determined to be more appropriate in Series 10. This series was processed by Rose Oliveira, Archives and Research Assistant, in January 2016.

In MS196.011: Administrative records, this series was processed by Dan Bullman, Archives and Research Assistant, in February 2016. Some personally identifiable information was found, so a 75 year restriction was applied to the series.
In MS196.012: Strategic planning records, this series was processed by Dan Bullman, Archives and Research Assistant, in February 2016.
Notes from Erin Dornbusch, a former ACCION International intern who worked on this collection, were retained in the analog collection documentation file for MS196.
Accession MS-2020-049, including administrative, financial, and human resources records in Series 4, 7, and 10, were processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in Spring 2020.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the operations of ACCION International, a global nonprofit institution specializing in microfinance.

Records include executive office and departmental files; financial records; the records of centers, programs, and initiatives; and conference materials. In addition to correspondence, memoranda, meeting minutes, reports, and publications, there are audiovisual materials and photographs. The bulk of the collection dates from 1960 to 2005 and primarily relates to ACCION's programs and microfinance institutions (MFIs) in Latin America, the Caribbean, and the United States; there is also some material pertaining to ACCION's operations in Africa and Asia.

The files and papers of several key ACCION employees are integrated into the collection. This includes presidents and CEOs Michael Chu (1993-1999) and Maria Otero (2000-2009); Carlos Castello, executive vice president and head of Global Programs (2006-2016); Susana Barton, vice president and program manager (2004-2012); and Cathy Quense, chief financial officer (1996-2008).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: ACCION International was founded in 1961 by Joseph H. Blatchford, a recent graduate from the University of California, Berkeley Law School. Moved to action by the political upheaval and poverty he saw traveling in Latin America, Blatchford viewed community grassroots development as a way to help improve lives. In 1961, he enlisted the help of two other UC Berkeley students, Jerry Brady and Gary Glenn, to recruit the first class of thirty American volunteers to work on their first projects in Venezuela.

ACCION's initial projects involved improving infrastructure in the community through both fundraising and manual labor such as building schools and digging ditches. They also worked to provide technical support and assistance, enabling local residents to embark on their own projects. Blatchford expanded ACCION with chapters in Brazil, Peru, and New York in the late 1960s. In the first decade of ACCION's existence, the news media frequently made comparisons between the organization and the Peace Corps. Blatchford was appointed Director of the Peace Corps in 1969.

In the 1970s, ACCION sought to address lack of economic opportunity in urban Latin America by establishing a microlending program. In 1973 the ACCION organization UNO (Recife, Brazil), issued its first loans to small, informal enterprises. ACCION's success in microlending led to their subsequent focus on microfinance. From 1980 to 1990, ACCION established microfinance programs in fourteen Latin American and Caribbean countries. In 1984, ACCION created the Latin American Bridge Fund, a guaranteed fund through which ACCION affiliates could secure lines of credit.

The Gran Salto "Great Leap" expansion campaign of the 1990s developed ACCION's programs in the United States as well as extending their reach in Latin America. In 1991, ACCION founded the ACCION U.S. Network to create microfinance programs in the United States. The pilot program was launched in Brooklyn, New York and the program grew steadily across the United States.

In 1992, ACCION joined with nonprofit microlender PRODEM and other local banks and investors to found BancoSol, the world's first commercial bank focused solely on microfinance, in Bolivia. ACCION established the Gateway Fund to make investments in microfinance institutions worldwide in 1996 and continued to expand its international operations outside the Americas in the 2000s by establishing partnerships with aspiring small business owners in sub-Saharan Africa and India. A partnership with Ecobank led to the founding of EB-Accion Savings and Loans in Ghana in 2007.

ACCION established the Center for Financial Inclusion (CFI), a think tank dedicated to taking action to ensure broad access to financial services, in 2008. CFI has collaborated with microfinance experts, financial advisers, banking institutions, investors, and a number of other stakeholders to achieve its goals of financial inclusion.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Specific restrictions are noted in the Detailed Contents List in each series.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Requests for publication will be forwarded to Accion.

Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish.
Any intellectual property rights which the donor possesses have not been transferred to Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records detailing the origins and creation of ACCION International. These records include correspondence, project reports, clippings from the 1960s and 1970s, financials, bylaws and corporate records, press releases, pamphlets, and information bulletins from ACCION Venezuela and ACCION Colombia from the 1960s, as well as The Politics of the Barrios of Venezuela byTalton F. Ray, and letterhead. The bulk of the materials are from 1960-1973, dating from the founding of ACCION to the creation of UNO. UNO was a small pilot program started in 1972 in Recife, Brazil that began ACCION's work in microfinance.

Correspondence includes letters between ACCION founder Joseph H. Blatchford and various foundations, government offices, universities and colleges, corporations, and individuals applying and participating in the program. Project reports from Maricabo, Venezuela, document some of the earliest projects of ACCION. This series also contains information put together by ACCION's Department of Communication and External Affairs that outlines the growth of the company and provides contextual information about its origins and founding. This material was used in part for publicity and for staff training.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and arranged in received order. The material was collected and arranged by Robin Radcliffe, the vice president of communications, prior to her retirement in 2011. Two accessions (2013.123 and 2015.020) were consolidated, arranged at the container level, and added to this series in 2016 by Rose Oliveira.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains board packets, meeting minutes, correspondence, memoranda, bylaws, notes, manuals, reports, and electronic files of the Board of Directors. The bulk of this material ranges from 1998 to 2008 and documents the decisions and actions of the Board of Directors. Also included are materials from several committees and councils including the Gateway Investment Committee, Nominating Committees, Advisory Council, and the Ad Hoc Strategy and Risk Committee. Board packets include lists of attendees, correspondence, agendas, minutes, committee and program reports, topics of discussion, and addenda. Some board packets are annotated by Cathy Quense or Roy Jacobowitz .These materials document changes to the bylaws, the development of programs and initiatives, and problems and solutions discussed by the board.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and arranged in received order. Materials from accession 2015.020 were added to the beginning of box 044.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence, reports, notes, press releases, electronic files, and a briefing book that document the work of ACCION International chief executive officers. The bulk of the materials range from 1993 to 1995 and documents ACCION's programs including high level summaries of ACCION's work with Corposol, a Colombian microfinance institution. Also included are Maria Otero's statements before the United States House of Representatives Committee on International Relations and articles written by Michael Chu on microfinance. Electronic files contain speeches from the files of Bruce MacDonald in Communications, and correspondence from the files of Ellen Bauer in the Executive Office.

These materials come from the files of Cathy Quense, chief financial officer (CFO) (1996-2008) and chief deputy/chief administrative officer (2008-2012), and Michael Chu, president and CEO (1993-1999).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and is arranged in its received order. Two boxes from different accessions (2013.123.and 2015.020) were consolidated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains budgets, financial statements, memoranda, minutes, notes, presentations, and other records of ACCION International's Audit, Finance and Investment Committee. The financial statements and meeting minutes provide information about ACCION's investments, insurance policies, revenue streams, and expenses. Also included are supplementary meeting materials, such as newspaper columns and articles, circulated to members of the committee in advance of each meeting.
Two folders of Cathy Quense's files include her own meeting notes, memoranda, and written presentations.
This series is restricted 20 years from date of creation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order, which is roughly chronological.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual reports, press releases, speeches, conference records, reprints, clippings, pamphlets, bulletins, and other materials created by ACCION International's office of Communications and External Affairs. Also included are marketing presentations, photographs, promotional videos and commercials, audio and video segments from news broadcasts and interviews, media pitches, event records, and administrative records including correspondence, memos, planning documents, and media contact sheets. The bulk of the materials date from 1985 to 2005. Communications and External Affairs was responsible for ACCION's communications and marketing programs, including branding, outreach, media affairs, digital marketing, internal communications, events, publications, public relations, and development.

Speeches by ACCION executive officers, such as Michael Chu and Maria Otero, in sub-series 002 are of particular note and provide important contextual information about the views and goals of the organization's leadership. Additionally, there is abundant material in the series that documents ACCION's participation in the Microcredit Summit Campaign, established in 1997. Hillary Clinton was the keynote speaker at the first Microcredit Summit, held in Washington, D.C. in February 1997. Other materials in sub-series 003 and 004 document ACCION's working relationship with Hillary Clinton on projects, such as the Clinton Global Initiative, related to poverty reduction in Asia and Latin America.
Materials are in English and Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in six sub-series: Annual reports; Communication and development files; Vice President of Communications records; Reprints and publicity; Publications; and Photographs and audiovisual materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Physical condition. 75 years from the date of creation. 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains ACCION International's Annual reports from 1964-2010, annual reports for ACCION USA from 1999-2005, and annual reports from regional branches from 1996-2008. Many of the reports are in Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged chronologically by organization (ACCION International, ACCION USA, ACCION Regional Branches).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records relating to ACCION International's outward communication and development including awards, press releases, listings, conference and meeting files, speeches and staff presentations. The files in this series are a record of ACCION's efforts to advertise and promote the organization. Listings are records of their advertisements and other mention of ACCION in print media. Press releases are announcements sent to media outlets for release and include job announcements for upper management, announcements for events, conferences and major projects. Conference and meeting files contain schedules, notes, summaries, memos, correspondence, and planning material for conferences and other meetings hosted and attended by ACCION staff. Conferences and meetings include but are not limited to: Microenterprise Development Conference, Congress of the Americas: World Economic Development, Congrencia de Directores, DAI Workshop on Microenterprise Finance and Development, Harvard Latin American Business Conference, CGAP Consultative Forum, Microfinance Network Conference, and the Microcredit Summit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in original order, which is roughly chronological.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

Vice President of Communications and External Affairs files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the working files of the Vice President of Communications and External Affairs. Records were created by vice presidents Robin Ratcliffe (1997-2004) and Bruce MacDonald (2013 on). The files in this subseries relate to the Vice President's work leading the Communications and External Affairs staff. Robin Ratcliffe's files include impact data for use in marketing and promotion, annual financial statements and analysis, notes, planning files for meetings (speaker lists, correspondence, contact lists), partnerships and alliance files (correspondence, marketing, promotion materials), appointment announcements (correspondence, press releases),and planning and correspondence with Hilary Clinton's staff for the First Lady's remarks to the Sixth Conference of Wives of Heads of State and of Governments of the Americas in Bolivia. It also includes pitches or letters sent to potential funders, supporters, magazines, and presidential candidates that promote ACCION from various angles (debt, Chicago, women). It also includes focus group reports, advertisements including spec sheets, ad prices/sizes, ad drafts, marketing plans, brochures, meeting agendas and attendance lists, as well as celebrity partnerships and projects.

Bruce MacDonald's files include strategic Initiative presentations, conference planning, branding materials, guide for hiring managers, correspondence about branding and conferences, press releases, media contacts, direct mailings, Clinton Global Initiative, Clinton Global Initiative progress reports, statements of commitment, annual report outlines, drafts and notes, media briefing sheets, records relating to Banco Compartamos' initial public offerings including: reports, presentations, correspondence, and its impact on ACCION.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in original order, which is roughly chronological.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains publicity records and reprints from media outlets in print and audiovisual formats. It includes pitches to mainstream media relating to fundraising efforts, projects and campaigns, CEO Maria Otero, and micro-lending in general. There are also folders for specific media contacts. Folders for specific magazines, journals, newspapers and other publications contain correspondence and drafts of articles. This sub-series also includes video and audio clips collected by communications staff that are by or about ACCION International and ACCION's regional branches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series includes publications created and distributed by ACCION International. These include InSight, Ventures, and the ACCION bulletins. These publications were distributed to interested parties and give updates on the organization's projects, campaigns, successes and needs. This sub-series also contains audiovisual material and photographs. The videocassettes and DVDs are of documentaries and advertisements created by ACCION. In addition to PSAs, advertisements and client profiles, there are also longer films including "Bootstrap Entrepreneurs," "Passport out of Poverty," "Los Informales: The Other Economy," "Washed Away," "Helping Millions Help Themselves," and "Voices from the Field - Three Films about Building Financial Inclusion through Microfinance."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains photographic prints, negatives, slides, film reels, video and audiotapes, and digital photographs documenting ACCION International's activities worldwide. The bulk of the materials date from 1980 to 2005. Most of this sub-series focuses on ACCION's microfinance programs in Latin American countries, but there are also photographs from Africa and India. Of particular note are ACCION's delegations sent to countries such as Peru, Ecuador and Bolivia. Additionally, there are a number of photographs of ACCION's foreign microfinance institutions (MFIs), such as Bancosol in Bolivia and Banco Solidario in Ecuador, and their clientele.

Also included are a number of photographs of ACCION staff members, social gatherings, events, and fundraisers. There are numerous photographs of Maria Otero, who joined ACCION in 1986 and served as President and CEO from 2000 to 2009.

Audiocassettes contain radio interviews, conference sessions (such as the plenary of the 1997 Microcredit Summit), and other ACCION International events such as fundraisers and luncheons. Of particular interest are materials about the informal economy in Latin America, such as "The Message of the Informal Sector." Some of the audio is in Spanish.
Videotapes contain ACCION promotional videos, short news segments about ACCION, interviews, and productions about microcredit.
Titles of digital photographs were derived from the file names where possible, and were assigned general titles when file names were not meaningful.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in received order, which is grouped broadly by region.

scopecontent.p: This box contains two Accion film reels. The reels are in poor condition (vinegar syndrome).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, memoranda, reports, grant proposals, program descriptions, contracts, budgets, newsletters, prospect files, and brochures of ACCION International's Resource Development Office. The Resource Development Office oversaw the cultivation and stewardship of giving from individuals, foundations, and corporate institutions as well as grants from governments and multinational institutions. The bulk of the materials date from 1985 to 2005 and document the many projects and programs ACCION proposed and implemented with the support of various people, foundations, and agencies. For example, the 1991 Gran Salto Expansion Campaign, which expanded ACCION's programs in Latin America and the United States, is documented in this series. Major partners include the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), a government agency that provided grant support to ACCION's projects, especially in Latin America, and the International Finance Group (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group. Of note is a memorandum on Maria Otero's 1999 meeting with Hillary Clinton in Bolivia (see MS196.007.049), which includes a letter from Hillary Clinton.
Materials are primarily in Spanish and English.
This series is restricted for 75 years from date of creation due to privacy concerns.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and arranged in received order. Partial boxes were consolidated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains compensation and benefits information, employee manuals, organizational charts, photograph albums, surveys, and other records from the Human Resources department of ACCION International. The organizational structure documents give a broad overview of ACCION's objectives of providing technical and financial assistance to microentrepreneurs, particularly in Latin America.

The photograph albums (box 091) provide a visual history of ACCION's outreach activities, such as training sessions and workshops, in Latin America in the 1980s and 1990s. There are also photographs of ACCION events, such as conferences and staff parties.
Materials are in English and Spanish.
This series is restricted for 75 years from date of creation, with the exception of photo albums, which are open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order, which is roughly chronological.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation. Open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains documents related to ACCION's organizational structure and values, internal newsletters, employee handbooks and policies, employee survey results, and mentor/mentee program information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains published monographs, reports, technical guides, working papers, conference proceedings, training materials, annual reports, case studies, catalogs, and correspondence that document the Center for Financial Inclusion's mission of full global financial inclusion. Launched in 2008, The Center for Financial Inclusion is an action-oriented think tank that collaborates with key industry partners to address challenges to global financial inclusion. The bulk of the materials are publications dating from 1989 to 2000 that address best practices, research, training, and policy guidance on microenterprise development worldwide. These publications were produced by ACCION International, ACCION U.S. Network, and the Center for Financial Inclusion, as well as partner organizations including the Microfinance Network, Calmeadow, and the United States Agency for International Development's Growth and Equity through Microenterprise Investments and Institutions (GEMINI) project. The GEMINI series includes a run of working papers and technical reports. Working papers runs from 2 to 50 and are missing 1, 14, 40, and 43. The technical reports run from 1-83 and are missing 1, 5, 63, 68-71, 77.

Also of interest are course materials from a joint program between ACCION and the Harvard Business School on strategic leadership for microfinance. The course materials include annotations by Maria Otero, president and CEO of ACCION from 2000 to 2009. Files created by Cathy Quense, ACCION CFO from 1996 to 2008, include CFI publications and annual reports.
Materials are in English, Spanish, and Portuguese.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and in received order. Partial boxes were consolidated.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation. Open for research.

did.unittitle: Publications: ACCION, Microfinance Network, and GEMINI
Publications: GEMINI technical reports and working papers
Publications: GEMINI publications and ACCION USA

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuals, strategic plans, statistics, advisory reports, presentations, transparencies, guidebooks, correspondence, memoranda, meeting minutes, notes, reports, business plans, newsletters, clippings, articles, and pamphlets created by ACCION's Global Program division. Global Programs provides financial tools including microloans, business training, and other financial services to microfinance institutions (MFIs). Global Programs partners are MFIs in Latin America, the United States, China, India, and Africa. The bulk of the materials range from 1985 to 2008 and documents the development of ACCION's partnerships, primarily in Latin America and the United States.

The subseries document many areas of interest. Partner information contains MFI information from its Latin American program partners. This includes correspondence, reports, plans, bulletins, newsletters, clippings, and articles. The bulk of the material pertains to BancoSol, the first commercial bank in the world dedicated solely to microenterprise, which ACCION helped to found in Bolivia in 1992. Training materials include manuals and programs developed by ACCION for its MFIs. An example is Dialogo de Gestiones, an educational model geared toward entrepreneurs based on modules used in Central and South America. Planning documents and presentations include information on microfinance, business plans, and proposals for its MFIs. Also of interest are Red Books, ACCION International's yearly reporting of statics, which span the years 1985 to 1997, and advisory reports of its Latin American programs, many of which pertain to Colombia.
Files were created by Carlos Castello, head of Global Programs (2006-2016); Susana Barton, vice president and program manager (2004-2012); and Cathy Quense, ACCION CFO (1996 to 2008).
Materials are in Spanish, English, and Portuguese.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and arranged in 10 subseries identified by ACCION. Subseries were noted on boxes and materials were arranged into subseries accordingly. These subseries are: Partner information; Training materials; Planning documents and presentation; Red Books and statistics; Director's meetings; Memoranda of understanding; Investments; Products and services; Head of Department files; and U.S. expansion and board meetings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation. 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

did.unittitle: Centro ACCION Microempresarial and ACCION International, Colombia

accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains organizational preparedness and disaster planning documents, emergency contact information, legal documents, management meeting minutes, and other records pertaining to the operation and administrative activities of ACCION International. The bulk of the materials date from approximately 1993 to 2008. Of particular note are planning documents relating to ACCION International's 2001 move of their offices in Somerville and Cambridge to Roland Street in Boston. Many of the files in this series were created by Cathy Quense, chief financial officer (CFO) (1984-2009).
Materials are in English and Spanish.
This series is restricted for 75 years from date of creation, due to privacy concerns.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order. Materials from the files of Cathy Quense were arranged at the end of the series.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains monthly reports for senior management pertaining to communications, events, finance, human resources, investments, operations, and resource development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains strategic planning documents, including drafts, correspondence, and notes. The materials in this series date from approximately 1994 to 2005.

The strategic plans describe the mission and goals for ACCION International on a near-term basis, usually three to four years, and serve as a guidebook for staff. The documents discuss ACCION's focus as an organization, and include suggestions for becoming more effective and efficient. The plans were developed with input from staff at all levels, but particularly members of senior management. Many of the strategic plans are drafts labeled with the note "Confidential: For Internal Distribution Only."
Materials in this series are in English and Spanish.
Files in Box 090 were created by Cathy Quense, chief financial officer (1984-2009).
This series is restricted for 20 years from date of creation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

did.unittitle: Strategic planning records: Cathy Quense files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains agendas, lists of participants, conference proceedings, and conference notes. The bulk of the material ranges from 1987 to 1999 and represents an internal annual conference for ACCION directors. These conferences occurred all over the world and participants included directors of ACCION, its partner members, and invited speakers. This conference provided an opportunity for departments to present, plan, and to hold workshops on topical items. The name of this conference varied over time, from the Conferencia de Personal in the 1980s, to the Conferencia de Directores from the early 1990s on, to Conferencia de Directores de la Red ACCION beginning in 1999.

Also represented in this series is the Microfinance Network conference, with participants from several microfinance companies. Conference topics include tapping into capital markets, working with investors, incentives for information technology staff, and innovations in rural finance. Other conference materials may be found in Series 006, Communications and External Affairs records.
Materials are primarily in Spanish and English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is minimally processed and arranged in received order, which is roughly chronological.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of 2 websites crawled by DCA to document the presence of Accion on the web. The websites in this series are crawled on an annual basis.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Archived websites can be viewed online using the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine.

did.unittitle: Accion | Investing in Individuals. Improving our World.
